{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3539277,"name":"","username":"Tertola2513","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/b487fb/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-25T14:22:54.541Z","cooked":"

Our team is trying to use motion magic for our elevator and are running into the issue that I can’t send a positioning command to the motor even if just using the phoenix tuner X selected to MotionMagicDutyCylce, I have not had a chance to tune PID or SVGA values so they all stand at 0 and our Target velocity, acceleratoin and Jerk are all set to 6000 with units in regards to rps,
below is the code request I am trying to send to the motor with maxPos = 100

public void maxPos() {
final MotionMagicVoltage m_pivotRequest = new MotionMagicVoltage(0);

m_primaryMotor.setControl(m_pivotRequest.withPosition(PivotConstants.maxPos));

}

You’ll need to add PID values before it will do anything. Just to get it moving, start with some small numbers for P and increase until it moves at a good speed.

PID stands for Proportional, Integral, Differential. The P constant is multiplied by your error (setpoint - current position) to get the motor output. When P=0, your telling motion magic to multiply by 0, so the output will always be 0.
